pr_title: Allow specifying an exclusive set of fields on ObjectParser

timeline.message: Allow specifying an exclusive set of fields on ObjectParser

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't throw an exception though!
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: Oh, I see. It does, but later. Got it. Maybe update the comment. Not sure.

timeline.bodyText: I think it might be worth mentioning that it doesn't make foo or bar required.
timeline.author: nik9000

revised_code.chunk: diff --git a/libs/x-content/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/common/xcontent/AbstractObjectParser.java b/libs/x-content/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/common/xcontent/AbstractObjectParser.java index 0da89089651..e0ea0d511e2 100644 --- a/libs/x-content/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/common/xcontent/AbstractObjectParser.java +++ b/libs/x-content/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/common/xcontent/AbstractObjectParser.java @@ -299,7 +299,9 @@ public abstract class AbstractObjectParser * Declares a set of fields of which at most one must appear for parsing to succeed * * E.g. declareExclusiveFieldSet("foo", "bar"); means that only one of 'foo' - * or 'bar' must be present, and if both appear then an exception will be thrown. + * or 'bar' must be present, and if both appear then an exception will be thrown. Note + * that this does not make 'foo' or 'bar' required - see {@link #declareRequiredFieldSet(String...)} + * for required fields. * * Multiple exclusive sets may be declared *

timeline.bodyText: I tend to put this on the variable that needs it for extra paranoia.
